info.author: Kevin Mills
info.description:
BPRE Build Tools
----------------

This just packages Touched’s insert and build scripts for BPRE for
setuptools and pip.

How to install?
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

``pip install bpre-build-tools``

How to use?
~~~~~~~~~~~

If you’re familar wth Touched/FBI’s C project directory structure,
congratulations, you already know how to use this. Because that is
literally all this is! Ripped straight from `here`_, they haven’t been
modified.

Once you have installed, they should be added to your PATH. Rather than
calling, for example, ``python scripts/build`` you just call
``bpre-build``. There are two build scripts - ``bpre-build`` and
``bpre-build2``. There are three insert scripts - ``bpre-insert``,
``bpre-insert2``, and ``bpre-insert3``. Which one you use will depend on
how you set up your environment.

The build and insert scripts expect a particular project structure to be
formed by the current working directory. In particular, you should have
a ``hooks`` file, a ``BPRE.ld`` file, a ``linker.ld`` file, and a
``src`` directory. A minimal project skeleton can be found
`here <https://github.com/Sagiri/bpre-minimal-skeleton>`__.

The build scripts take no command line arguments.

The insert scripts have four command line arguments.

| ``bpre-insert --debug`` will print out all the symbols and where they
  were inserted.
| ``bpre-insert --offset 500`` will insert at 500. The argument must be
  in decimal, and defaults to (the decimal equivalent of) 0x800000.
| ``bpre-insert --input in.gba --output out.gba`` will read from
  ``in.gba`` and write to ``out.gba``. They default to ``BPRE0.gba`` and
  ``test.gba``, respectively.

.. _here: https://github.com/EternalCode/Empty-Template
